data.title: Zesty Hawaiian
data.text:
The food here is so flavorful and unique. It's Hawaiian but also modern in its flavor. Get there before 6pm and Happy Hour specials will wow you. The service is excellent. The atmosphere bustling but fun. Great cocktails!!! I recommend the Mai Tai. We had two appetizers- the edamame which was so spicy, you need the Mai Tai. And the coconut shrimp roll. Tasty and helps cut the spice of the edamame. Unique flavors that wow you!!!!  The wasabi fish special (we chose Mahi mahi) was delicious and fresh. Came with broccolini and wasabi mashed potatoes. Perfect!!!  Plan to come back!

Great service too!!!!

data.title: Nice casual dining
data.text: It was a beautiful evening and all the doors were open out to the sidewalk, which was very pleasant.  We had ribs, poke and the Hula burger.  All very good.  The Maitais also got good reviews.

data.title: Great hamburgers
data.text: Stopped in for lunch. Unusual atmosphere for Old Town. Service a little slow, but food very fresh and good.

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: I lunched here with a friend during a day of shopping and exploring in/around Phoenix. She had been before, she works in the area. We say at the bar, service was excellent. Our barmaid/server was extremely friendly and offered suggestions. The Mai Tai was incredible and the food delicious. I would definitely visit again.

data.title: Very chill vibe with great cocktails
data.text:
My wife and I stopped in to Hula's which came highly recommended from a tour that we attended.  Very nice spot to stop and relax, grab a bit and some drink.  Tacos were excellent, drinks that the server recommended were right on and refreshing.  Service was very good from the hostess to the server.  
A+ 

Thanks Hula's, see you again in the future if we're ever back in the area.

Sincerely,

John and Amy

data.title: Cool Bar with Good Food
data.text: This place was near my hotel and looked like a good alternative to most of the places near Old Scottsdale.  I was glad I stopped in.  The Ahi tacos I had were very good and the drinks are excellent as well.

data.title: Combo Sunday late breakfast - early lunch
data.text:
We walked from the Marriot, relaxed and had drinks before "brunch". Everyone was helpful and the food was very good.
My wife had Pork tacos and I had the corned beef hash dish, the corned beef hash is actually a pork blend of pulled pork, various peppers, very good.  The white rice was very good.
Since we live out of state and we're in Scottsdale for the weekend, we WOULD return if we were in the area.
The restaurant has a Hawaiian tropical food, very good for just finding the restaurant "around the corner".  
Also numerous Tropical beers, I had a Hinano, a wonderful Tahitian beer.  We haven't been to Moorea in years, but at least Hinano is making it to the States.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Really great place for lunch! I was here with a group of six coworkers and we all enjoyed our food. I had a shrimp and a fish taco - delicious! And, the service was very good as well. I would definitely recommend this place!

data.title: I'm glad the rock pile didn't stop us
data.text: These are hard times as my wife is having medical problems and can't walk at this time and needs a wheelchair.  This does not stop us from eating in some of the wonderful restaurants in our area.  Case in point, we arrived at Hula and parked in a disabled parking spot and then couldn't find a way into the restaurant until a server came out and she removed lots of large rocks sitting on a couple of tarps blocking the opening to the restaurant's rear door.  What a lovely person she is!  I'm so glad we were able to get in because the food was excellent.  It was 2pm on a Tuesday and only two tables were occupied.  A good looking bar and table area greeted our senses.  We ordered sandwiches, made so well you hated to rip into them with bared teeth.  I had a blackened sea bass [HAPU] sandwich with taco slaw and sun-dried tomato pesto aioli, and the wife had a fried calamari steak strips sandwich with the same condiments.  The best and freshest tasting seafood, perfectly prepared were trapped between the 2 wonderful halves of a freshly baked large roll.  Also ordered a side of french fries, crispy on the outside, and tender inside.  Cooked the way they should be cooked or should I say fried. We had an epicurean and delightful moment orally shredding these tasty morsels.  Service was spot on despite the energy consumed by moving many mini boulders :).  We shall return to try the many wonderful items on their menu.  What a hidden gem.  If you like fresh seafood or just well prepared meals, this is the place!  On the way out we were shown the correct way out by using the sidewalk out front.  Too bad our server didn't know and had to work so hard but I love her for it.

data.title: Bring on the Mai Tai's
data.text: This is a great place for HH especially on Wednesdays. it lasts from 3-11. Drink menu is extensive, food menu is tasty. I really liked their fish cakes, ceviche and their pork taco. The signature Mai Tai is not your average fruity Mai Tai. It had depth and complexity!!  The patio provides a cool relaxing ambience, especially this time of year I would definitely rate it a 4 out if 5. Enjoy the Photos!!

data.title: We go there all the time now!
data.text: Breakfast, lunch, dinner, or happy hour this place does NOT disappoint! Unique menu of quality food at a reasonable price and GREAT drinks!

data.title: Hula's
data.text: I've been to hula's several times now in Scottsdale and it is really great food. I have had the fish tacos -- they were excellent. Today I had the ahi bowl with wasabi cream sauce, rice, black beans and cabbage. And again it was delicious. They have a fair menu for happy hour and lunch specials. One night we went in and ordered about 8 or 9 appetizers to share and everyone was impressed. They do offer a discount if you work in the industry as well! I will be back.

data.title: Great food at decent price
data.text: Happy hour drink specials were a great deal. Poke and ceviche were tasty. Took off a star for relatively small portion. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Scottsdale.

data.title: Tropical treats flood the menue!
data.text: Took my teenaged children here for dinner during the week. We all enjoyed our fresh meals with creative presentation. i sampled a few of the creative and fresh adult beverages. Of course the kids had to drive home.....the cocktails pack a punch!

data.title: Great mai tai - food not as great
data.text: This place serves great cocktails - the mai tai was fabulous!  Dinner options were fine, just not as good as the drinks!

data.title: Late lunch on a Sunday
data.text: The restaurant wasn't terribly busy when we were there, which was nice, as we pretty much had our server's undivided attention, even though he did have a few other tables. I ordered a pina colada but was informed they didn't have a blender but our waiter was very knowledgeable and suggested another drink very similar. Our order consisted of the lobster bisque (enough for 4 of us to have a bit), hula burger, cajun burger, cajun ahi caesar salad, south seas fish tacos and a plain burger made special for my grandson. You have to pay extra if you want a side. Food was great and delivered in a timely manner. The only con I have is that the music was just too loud. I realize the restaurant is setting a club vibe/atmosphere, but I don't enjoy trying to have a conversation, especially at lunch, and yell at my table mates. The music in the restroom was twice as loud. Other than that, we would definitely eat there again.

data.title: Best Mai-Tai since Trader Vic's day!
data.text: You cannot have a restaurant named Hula's and not serve a good Mai-Tai. Not since my days of visiting Trader Vic's have I enjoyed a Mai-Tai as much as I did at Hula's. Mai Tai—Roa Aé! If the Mai-Tai isn't to your taste, there are plenty of other cocktails and beers to satisfy your Arizona thirst. As for food – I came in hungry and left satisfied. So happy I found this place the first day of my Scottsdale stay so I could visit again on the second!

data.title: Slow  learners.. Gave this place six tries
data.text: We love , the Phoenix location and have tried this one repeatedly since it is close to home. It seems they can't keep staff or at least find good staff ? The food has been good sometimes and not good other others. We didn't get to even try the food last night as we couldn't get waited on we sat at the bar and they has two bartenders working, we received first drink but that is where it ended. We kept  waving for sevice but totally ignored. Finally we got one of the bartenders, attention but we finally  just asked for the check.  The bartender never asked why we decided to leave but we told him. He replied they were busy with a flood ?? It had rained for ten minutes that night ? We told the three servers, leaning on a table but they were not concerned.  Scottsdale, has great restaurants and this is not on the list.

data.title: Dinner and cocktails
data.text: Loved it! We had first of all the best service ever! Our server JHarnys went out of his way to tell us all about the menu and drinks. I had the Baja fish tacos and they were delicious and big. He recommended the Mia Tai and it was excellent. My husband had the Jerk chicken sandwich and he loved it. Overall a great experience.

data.title: Appetizers made me Hula!
data.text: Liked this  restaurant club feel but selection of food had variety .  My teen loved it.  They have a happy hours time for a drink and appetizers .  We loved all the apps but would not have the Thai chicken next time as it was more of a peanut them chilli . Friendly staff prices good with their discount times. I would go again.
